Uses of Class
calculator.UNumber

    • Uses of UNumber in calculator

      Methods in calculator that return UNumber 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      UNumber UNumber.squareRoot(UNumber originalValue)
      This squareRoot routine finds out the square root of a UNumber.
      Methods in calculator with parameters of type UNumber 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void UNumber.add(UNumber that)
      The Addition operation adds the second operand to this object's value (this = this + that) The code implements the addition in a very simplistic manner, sacrificing speed and space for a very simple algorithm that mirrors how people do addition by hand.
      int UNumber.compareTo(UNumber that)
      This compareTo routine satisfies the "Comparable" interface
      void UNumber.div(UNumber that)
      The divide operation implements division by means of repeated subtraction, producing as many significant digits in the quotient as in the dividend (this object) and the quotient replaces the dividend.
      boolean UNumber.greaterThan(UNumber that)
      This greaterThan routine tries to avoid doing a subtraction in order to do things faster.
      boolean UNumber.lessThan(UNumber that)
      This lessThan routine tries to avoid doing a subtraction in order to do things faster.
      void UNumber.mpy(UNumber that)
      The multiply operation implements multiplication is the traditional, by hand-hand manner, where each digit of the multiplicand is multiplied by each digit of the multiplier and adding into the proper digit of the product using the index of the multiplier digit as the base for the summation.
      UNumber UNumber.squareRoot(UNumber originalValue)
      This squareRoot routine finds out the square root of a UNumber.
      void UNumber.sub(UNumber that)
      The subtract operation negates the second operand and uses the add operator (this = this - that) The code uses a temporary for the second operand so the callers second operand is not changed
      Constructors in calculator with parameters of type UNumber 
      Constructor and Description
      UNumber(UNumber that)
      This is a copy constructor
      UNumber(UNumber that, int size)
      This is a copy constructor where the size of the new value is specified
      UNumber(UNumber that, UNumber another)
      This constructor creates a potentially unnormalized value (there maybe leading zeros) with enough space in the mantissa array to hold all of the significant digits of both input parameters at the same time.
